docs.snippet: The Obama administration on Tuesday ordered asset freezes and travel bans on two individuals, one on each side of the bloody conflict in South Sudan....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration on Tuesday ordered asset freezes and travel bans on two individuals, one on each side of the bloody conflict in South Sudan.
docs.abstract: United States imposes first sanctions in South Sudan conflict, ordering asset freezes and travel bans on Marial Chanuong, commander of government's presidential guard force who led attacks against civilians in Juba, and Peter Gadet, who led rebel forces in assault on Bentiu that killed more than 200 civilians.

headline.main: U.S. Imposes First Sanctions in South Sudan Conflict
headline.print_headline: U.S. Imposes First Sanctions in South Sudan Conflict

docs.snippet: The Supreme Court has enlarged the freedom of Americans to travel abroad by rejecting the punishment as criminals of persons with valid passports who visit Communist countries in defiance of a State Department travel ban. But it has not enlarged t...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court has enlarged the freedom of Americans to travel abroad by rejecting the punishment as criminals of persons with valid passports who visit Communist countries in defiance of a State Department travel ban. But it has not enlarged that freedom very much. This week's unanimous decision in effect makes one trip possible, but no more.
docs.abstract: ed urges Cong limit dept's power to warning citizens against travel in places where US can not protect them

docs.snippet: MOSCOW, June 22 -- The Soviet Foreign Office advised the United States and other embassies in Moscow tonight that travel restrictions for foreigners in large regions of European Russia, Byelorussia, the Ukraine, the Caucasus area and Central Asia ...
docs.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, June 22 -- The Soviet Foreign Office advised the United States and other embassies in Moscow tonight that travel restrictions for foreigners in large regions of European Russia, Byelorussia, the Ukraine, the Caucasus area and Central Asia had been removed.
docs.abstract: Govt repts curbs on foreigners, including diplomats, lifted in large areas of Eur Russia, Byelorussia, Ukraine, Caucasus and Central Asia; curbs in Moscow area to be eased; to be continued in Baltic states, certain sensitive areas

headline.main: SOVIET TRAVEL BAN AGAINST OUTSIDERS EASED BY MOSCOW; U.S. and Other Embassies Hear Curbs Are Lifted in Many European and Asian Areas Moscow Eases Curbs on Travel By Foreigners Throughout Soviet

byline.original: By HARRISON E. SALISBURYSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: PRAGUE, Czechoslovakia, Jan. 23 According to responsible Czechoslovak officials, relations with the United States have reached a "crisis" stage....
docs.lead_paragraph: PRAGUE, Czechoslovakia, Jan. 23 According to responsible Czechoslovak officials, relations with the United States have reached a "crisis" stage.
docs.abstract: Govt officials hold Czech-US relations at crisis point because of Kazan-Komarek case; charge US withholds most-favored-nation trade status because of 'unimportant' consular case; US embassy official visits Kazan-Komarek; Czech grievances discussed

headline.main: CZECHS SEE CRISIS IN TIES WITH U.S.; Causes Found in 'Spy' Case and American Visa Ban

byline.original: By HENRY KAMM Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 9 -- The State Department is refusing to issue passports to Americans to travel in Yugoslavia because of dangers there and has rejected a recent Yugoslav protest against this ban, it was announced today....
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 9 -- The State Department is refusing to issue passports to Americans to travel in Yugoslavia because of dangers there and has rejected a recent Yugoslav protest against this ban, it was announced today.
docs.abstract: April note to US State Dept asking for withdrawal of ban against tourist travel in Yugoslavia and US rejection disclosed

headline.main: U.S. BARS TRAVEL IN YUGOSLAV PERILS; Refuses to Issue Passports, Rejecting Ambassador's Note Protesting Our Ban

byline.original: By BERTRAM D. HULENSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MOSCOW, Aug. 14--Despite the warnings of their Government and the appeals of many of their parents, forty-one young Americans left Moscow by train today for a three-week tour of Communist China....
docs.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Aug. 14--Despite the warnings of their Government and the appeals of many of their parents, forty-one young Americans left Moscow by train today for a three-week tour of Communist China.

headline.main: 41 DEFY WARNING, SET OFF FOR CHINA; Americans in Moscow Insist on Their 'Right to Travel' 41 Defy Ban and Set Off for China 2 Concede Being 'Used' Minds Made Up Travelers Are Listed

byline.original: By MAX FRANKEL Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The Pocono Mountains Vacation Bureau, representing scores of resorts in this reglon, has started a campaign to appeal to Congress to have the Federal ban on DDT lifted temporarily to permit the spraying of area forests....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Pocono Mountains Vacation Bureau, representing scores of resorts in this reglon, has started a campaign to appeal to Congress to have the Federal ban on DDT lifted temporarily to permit the spraying of area forests.
docs.abstract: Pocono Mts Vacation Bur, representing scores of resorts in area, has started campaign to appeal to Cong to have Fed ban on DDT lifted temporarily to permit spraying of area forests; Penna Environmental Resources Dept repts that total of 175,000 acres in state have been infested with gypsy moths; bur's pres P Asure contends that DDT is 'only hope left' in combating gypsy moths, which he claims are devastating 4 Pocono Mt counties; says that any further destruction could threaten future of area as resort center; holds that harmful effects of DDT have been 'greatly exaggerated' by environmentalists; adds that substitute sprays have been ineffective, partly because they have to be used periodically

headline.main: Lifting of DDT Ban Sought in Poconos To Combat Moths; June 1 Is Date

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

headline.main: U. S. BAN ON QUARTET LIFTED; Canadian Entertainers Victors in Appeal on Entry Ruling

docs.snippet: Your editorial of July 9 entitled "Passport Scare" criticizes the bill recently sent to the Congress by President Eisenhower. This legislation seeks to return to the Secretary of State the right to deny passports to adherents of the Communist cons...
docs.lead_paragraph: Your editorial of July 9 entitled "Passport Scare" criticizes the bill recently sent to the Congress by President Eisenhower. This legislation seeks to return to the Secretary of State the right to deny passports to adherents of the Communist conspiracy and other persons whose travel abroad would harm the foreign policy objectives of the United States.
docs.abstract: lr on July 9 ed backs banning passports if natl security is involved

headline.main: Passport Law Advocated; Power to Ban Travel Held Needed if Security Is Involved
